resources.string: The onion (Allium cepa) is a common and versatile vegetable belonging to the lily family (Liliaceae). It\'s most known for its pungent flavor and tear-inducing properties when chopped.

The tomato (Solanum lycopersicum) is a fruit, although often referred to as a vegetable, that is native to South America. It is a member of the nightshade family, which also includes potatoes, eggplants, and peppers. Tomatoes are a versatile ingredient used in many cuisines around the world.
Baingan is the Hindi word for eggplant, a versatile vegetable native to India and widely cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions around the world.

Bitter gourd, also known as bitter melon, karela (India), nigauri (Japan), goya (Okinawa), ampalaya (Philippines), and ku-gua (China), is a tropical and subtropical vine of the Cucurbitaceae family, widely cultivated in Asia, Africa, and the Caribbean for its edible fruit.
The bottle gourd, also known as opo squash, long melon, lau ki (Hindi), calabash, and opo squash, is a versatile fruit/vegetable native to Africa but cultivated worldwide for its diverse uses.
"Broccoli is a vibrant green vegetable belonging to the cabbage family (Brassicaceae) and is known for its resemblance to a miniature tree. "
Green capsicum, also commonly called a green bell pepper, is the unripe fruit of the Capsicum annuum plant, belonging to the nightshade family alongside potatoes, tomatoes, and eggplants.
Red capsicum, also known as red bell pepper or sweet red pepper, is a type of capsicum that is similar in shape and flavour to other bell peppers, but turns a vibrant red color when fully ripe.
The carrot, a familiar and versatile root vegetable, is enjoyed worldwide for its sweet flavor, vibrant color, and numerous health benefits.
"The cucumber (Cucumis sativus) is a widely cultivated creeping vine plant in the gourd family (Cucurbitaceae) that bears cylindrical to spherical fruits, which are used as culinary vegetables. "
The potato (Solanum tuberosum) is a starchy, tuberous root vegetable native to the Andean region of South America.

The pumpkin, a vibrant symbol of autumn, is more than just a festive decoration for Halloween and Thanksgiving. It\'s a delicious and versatile fruit (technically a type of berry) with a rich history and diverse uses.
